ground_truth: The huge giant leaves the room, and Harry looks at him uncertainly, then shakes his head. A pure white landscape emerges as high-stepping white horses trot out of the snow-covered forest, drawing handsome sleighs full of students well-wrapped against the cold. In the Great Hall, now decorated with tall Christmas trees, the ceiling reflects the weather outside, and huge snowflakes float above the heads of the students sitting at the long, polished dining tables. Harry and Ron are sitting by themselves at the end of one of the tables when Hermione carries her meal down the hall and sits opposite them. She holds up two cakes. Later, followed by Harry, Ron peers around a statue in the corridor, makes sure the coast is clear, and lifts his crooked wand. Harry waves his wand, and the two cakes float into the air. Harry and Ron hide as Crabbe and Goyle appear with armfuls of cake. They see the floating cakes, grab them, and start to eat them, greedily smacking their lips and stuffing the cakes into their mouths. They suddenly stop chewing as their eyes roll up, and they both fall over backward and hit the floor. Later, in the girls' lavatory, Hermione fills three glasses and hands one to Harry and one to Ron. They look at their thick sludge suspiciously and put the hairs into the potion. Ron pulls a face, and clinking glasses, they all drink at once. Ron takes a swig and heads for the nearest cubicle, followed by Hermione. Harry drops his glass and clutches his stomach in agony. He staggers to the marble sink and leans on it. Looking down, he sees the skin on his hands begin to bulge and bubble, and when Harry looks into the mirror, his face is also erupting. As he watches, he gradually turns into podgy Goyle. He lifts his hand and touches his beefy face with plump fingers. Pleased with the transformation, Harry smiles, then turns and sees Ron coming out of the cubicle, transformed into fat-faced, dumpy Crabbe. They stare at each other. In a dark corridor, Percy Weasley spots them, and Draco Malfoy stares at Harry, then glares at Percy, giving him a withering look. In the Slytherin common room, Draco slumps onto a leather sofa. Looking around nervously, Harry and Ron sit opposite him. Ron clenches his fist, and Harry nudges Ron. Draco stares at Harry, then gets to his feet and looks down at him ominously. To Harry's relief, Draco backs off. Ron looks at Harry with surprise, picks up a small parcel, and shakes it. Harry shakes his head, and Draco puts the parcel in his pocket. Ron springs up, and Harry warns Ron, who looks at him in dismay as Harry touches his forehead where his scar is reappearing.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: The enormous behemoth exits the chamber, and Harry gazes at him doubtfully, then nods his head. A pristine alabaster vista appears as high-stepping pale steeds prance out of the snow-covered woodland, pulling attractive sleighs filled with pupils well-wrapped against the chill. In the Great Hall, now adorned with towering Christmas trees, the ceiling mirrors the climate outside, and vast snowflakes hover above the heads of the students sitting at the extended, gleaming dining tables. Harry and Ron are sitting by themselves at the end of one of the tables when Hermione carries her meal down the hall and sits across from them. She holds up two pastries. Later, followed by Harry, Ron peeks around a statue in the corridor, ensures the coast is clear, and lifts his crooked wand. Harry waves his wand, and the two pastries float into the air. Harry and Ron conceal themselves as Crabbe and Goyle emerge with armfuls of pastry. They see the floating pastries, snatch them, and commence to consume them, greedily smacking their lips and stuffing the pastries into their mouths. They abruptly stop chewing as their eyes roll up, and they both collapse backward and hit the floor. Later, in the girls' washroom, Hermione fills three goblets and hands one to Harry and one to Ron. They look at their thick sludge suspiciously and put the hairs into the concoction. Ron makes a face, and clinking goblets, they all drink at once. Ron takes a gulp and heads for the nearest cubicle, followed by Hermione. Harry drops his goblet and clutches his abdomen in agony. He lurches to the marble basin and leans on it. Looking down, he sees the skin on his hands begin to swell and blister, and when Harry looks into the mirror, his visage is also erupting. As he observes, he gradually turns into podgy Goyle. He lifts his hand and touches his beefy visage with plump fingers. Pleased with the metamorphosis, Harry grins, then turns and sees Ron coming out of the cubicle, transformed into chubby-faced, squat Crabbe. They gaze at one another. In a dim corridor, Percy Weasley spots them, and Draco Malfoy stares at Harry, then glowers at Percy, giving him a withering look. In the Slytherin common room, Draco slumps onto a leather couch. Looking around nervously, Harry and Ron sit across from him. Ron clenches his fist, and Harry nudges Ron. Draco stares at Harry, then gets to his feet and looks down at him menacingly. To Harry's relief, Draco withdraws. Ron looks at Harry with surprise, picks up a small package, and shakes it. Harry shakes his head, and Draco puts the package in his pocket. Ron springs up, and Harry cautions Ron, who looks at him in dismay as Harry touches his forehead where his scar is reappearing.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: The room is left by the huge giant, and Harry is looked at uncertainly by him, then his head is shaken. A pure white landscape is emerged by high-stepping white horses that trot out of the snow-covered forest, drawing handsome sleighs full of students well-wrapped against the cold. In the Great Hall, now decorated with tall Christmas trees, the weather outside is reflected by the ceiling, and huge snowflakes float above the heads of the students sitting at the long, polished dining tables. Harry and Ron sit by themselves at the end of one of the tables when their meal is carried by Hermione down the hall, and she sits opposite them. Two cakes are held up by her. Later, Harry follows Ron, who peers around a statue in the corridor, makes sure the coast is clear, and his crooked wand is lifted. The wand is waved by Harry, and the two cakes are floated into the air. Crabbe and Goyle appear with armfuls of cake as Harry and Ron hide. The floating cakes are seen by them, grabbed, and they start to eat them, greedily smacking their lips and stuffing the cakes into their mouths. Chewing is suddenly stopped by them as their eyes roll up, and they both fall over backward and hit the floor. Later, in the girls' lavatory, three glasses are filled by Hermione, and one is handed to Harry and one to Ron. Their thick sludge is looked at suspiciously by them, and the hairs are put into the potion. A face is pulled by Ron, and clinking glasses, they all drink at once. A swig is taken by Ron, and he heads for the nearest cubicle, followed by Hermione. Harry drops his glass and his stomach is clutched in agony. The marble sink is staggered to, and he leans on it. Looking down, the skin on his hands is seen beginning to bulge and bubble, and when the mirror is looked into by Harry, his face is seen erupting. As he watches, he gradually turns into podgy Goyle. His hand is lifted by him, and his beefy face is touched with plump fingers. The transformation pleases Harry, and a smile is given by him, then Ron is seen coming out of the cubicle, transformed into fat-faced, dumpy Crabbe. They stare at each other. In a dark corridor, they are spotted by Percy Weasley, and Draco Malfoy stares at Harry, then a withering look is given to Percy by Draco. In the Slytherin common room, Draco slumps onto a leather sofa. Nervously looking around, they sit opposite him. Ron's fist is clenched, and Ron is nudged by Harry. Draco stares at Harry, then to his feet, he gets and ominously looks down at him. Harry is relieved as Draco backs off. A look of surprise is given to Harry by Ron, who picks up a small parcel and shakes it. His head is shaken by Harry, and the parcel is put in Draco's pocket. Ron springs up, and Ron is warned by Harry, who is looked at in dismay as Harry's forehead is touched where his scar is reappearing.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: The giant exits, and Harry watches uncertainly before shaking his head. A snowy landscape appears as white horses pull sleighs filled with warmly dressed students from the forest. In the Great Hall, decorated with Christmas trees, the ceiling mirrors the weather, with snowflakes floating above students at the dining tables. Harry and Ron sit alone when Hermione joins them with two cakes. Later, Ron checks the corridor, lifts his wand, and Harry makes the cakes float. They hide as Crabbe and Goyle arrive, grab the cakes, and eat greedily. Suddenly, they stop chewing, their eyes roll up, and they fall backward. In the girls' lavatory, Hermione gives Harry and Ron glasses of potion. They add hairs, clink glasses, and drink. Ron rushes to a cubicle, followed by Hermione. Harry drops his glass, clutches his stomach, and staggers to the sink, watching his skin bubble. He transforms into Goyle, touches his new face, and smiles. Ron emerges as Crabbe, and they stare at each other. Percy Weasley spots them in a corridor, and Draco Malfoy glares at Percy. In the Slytherin common room, Draco sits on a sofa, and Harry and Ron sit nervously opposite. Ron clenches his fist, and Harry nudges him. Draco stands ominously but then backs off. Ron looks surprised, picks up a parcel, and Harry warns him as his scar reappears.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: The giant exits, and Harry watches him uncertainly, then shakes his head. White horses emerge from the snowy forest, pulling sleighs with warmly dressed students. In the Great Hall, decorated with Christmas trees, the ceiling mirrors the weather, and snowflakes float above students at dining tables. Harry and Ron sit alone when Hermione joins them with two cakes. Later, Ron checks the corridor, lifts his wand, and Harry makes the cakes float. Crabbe and Goyle appear, grab the cakes, eat greedily, then collapse. In the girls' lavatory, Hermione gives Harry and Ron glasses of potion. They add hairs, drink, and Ron rushes to a cubicle. Harry clutches his stomach, sees his skin bubble, and transforms into Goyle. Pleased, he sees Ron as Crabbe. Percy Weasley spots them, and Draco Malfoy glares at Percy. In the Slytherin common room, Draco sits on a sofa. Nervously, Harry and Ron sit opposite. Draco stands ominously but then backs off. Ron picks up a parcel, and Harry warns him as his scar reappears.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description:
The enormous giant, towering over everyone, exits the room with heavy footsteps, leaving Harry to gaze after him with a look of uncertainty etched on his face. Harry then shakes his head, trying to clear his thoughts. A pristine, pure white landscape gradually comes into view as elegant, high-stepping white horses emerge from the snow-covered forest. These majestic creatures are pulling handsome sleighs filled with students who are bundled up warmly against the biting cold. Inside the Great Hall, which is now beautifully adorned with tall, festive Christmas trees, the enchanted ceiling mirrors the wintry weather outside. Huge, delicate snowflakes float gently above the heads of the students who are seated at the long, polished dining tables. Harry and Ron find themselves sitting alone at the far end of one of these tables when Hermione approaches, carrying her meal down the hall. She takes a seat opposite them and holds up two cakes with a smile. 

Later on, with Harry following closely behind, Ron peers cautiously around a statue in the corridor. He ensures that the coast is clear before lifting his crooked wand. Harry, with a flick of his own wand, causes the two cakes to float effortlessly into the air. The two boys quickly hide as Crabbe and Goyle appear, their arms laden with cake. Spotting the floating cakes, they eagerly grab them and begin to eat, greedily smacking their lips and stuffing the cakes into their mouths with abandon. Suddenly, they stop chewing, their eyes rolling upwards, and they both fall backward, hitting the floor with a thud. 

Later, in the girls' lavatory, Hermione carefully fills three glasses and hands one to Harry and another to Ron. They eye the thick sludge inside the glasses with suspicion and then drop the hairs into the potion. Ron makes a face, and with a clink of their glasses, they all drink at once. Ron takes a swig and quickly heads for the nearest cubicle, with Hermione following closely behind. Harry, meanwhile, drops his glass and clutches his stomach in agony. He staggers over to the marble sink, leaning heavily on it for support. As he looks down, he notices the skin on his hands beginning to bulge and bubble. When Harry glances into the mirror, he sees his face erupting in a similar fashion. As he watches, he gradually transforms into the podgy Goyle. He lifts his hand and touches his newly beefy face with plump fingers. Pleased with the successful transformation, Harry smiles, then turns to see Ron emerging from the cubicle, now transformed into the fat-faced, dumpy Crabbe. They stare at each other in amazement.

In a dimly lit corridor, Percy Weasley spots them, and Draco Malfoy fixes his gaze on Harry, then turns to glare at Percy with a withering look. In the Slytherin common room, Draco slumps onto a leather sofa with an air of arrogance. Looking around nervously, Harry and Ron sit down opposite him. Ron clenches his fist in anticipation, and Harry gives Ron a nudge. Draco stares intently at Harry, then rises to his feet and looks down at him ominously. To Harry's immense relief, Draco eventually backs off. Ron looks at Harry with surprise, picks up a small parcel, and gives it a shake. Harry shakes his head in response, and Draco slips the parcel into his pocket. Ron springs up suddenly, and Harry quickly warns him. Ron looks at Harry in dismay as Harry touches his forehead, where his scar is beginning to reappear.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
The colossal giant, an imposing figure standing so much taller than all the others around him, exits the room with echoing, heavy footsteps, leaving Harry behind, who continues to gaze after him with a look of uncertainty clearly etched on his face. Harry then shakes his head in an attempt to clear his thoughts and gather his composure. A pristine, pure white landscape gradually unfolds into view as elegant, high-stepping white horses emerge from the snow-covered forest. These majestic creatures are gracefully pulling handsome sleighs filled with students who are bundled up warmly against the biting and frigid cold. Within the Great Hall, which is now beautifully and lavishly adorned with numerous tall, festive Christmas trees, the enchanted ceiling mirrors the wintry weather outside. Huge, delicate snowflakes float gently and softly above the heads of the students, who are seated at the long, polished dining tables. Harry and Ron find themselves sitting alone at the far end of one of these tables when Hermione approaches them, carrying her meal down the hall. She takes a seat directly opposite them and holds up two cakes with a welcoming smile.

Later on, with Harry following closely behind, Ron peers cautiously and carefully around a statue in the corridor. He ensures that the coast is entirely clear before lifting his crooked wand. Harry, with a flick of his own wand, causes the two cakes to float effortlessly into the air. The two boys quickly hide as Crabbe and Goyle appear, their arms laden with cake. Spotting these enticing floating cakes, they eagerly grab them and begin to eat, greedily smacking their lips and stuffing the cakes into their mouths with abandon. Suddenly, they stop chewing entirely, their eyes rolling upwards, and they both fall backward, hitting the floor with a heavy thud.

Later, in the somewhat dim and damp girls' lavatory, Hermione carefully fills three glasses and hands one to Harry and another to Ron. They eye the thick sludge inside the glasses with suspicion and trepidation, then drop the hairs into the potion. Ron makes a disgusted face and, with a clink of their glasses touching lightly, they all drink at once. Ron takes a quick swig and immediately heads for the nearest cubicle, with Hermione following closely behind him. Harry, meanwhile, drops his glass and clutches his stomach in agony. He staggers over to the marble sink, leaning heavily against it for support. As he looks down, he notices the skin on his hands beginning to bulge and bubble. When Harry glances into the mirror, he sees his face erupting in a similar, unsettling fashion. As he watches, he gradually transforms into the podgy Goyle. He lifts his hand and touches his newly beefy face with plump fingers. Pleased with the successful transformation, Harry smiles, then turns to see Ron emerging from the cubicle, now transformed into the fat-faced, dumpy Crabbe. They stare at each other in utter amazement.

In a dimly lit corridor, Percy Weasley spots them, and Draco Malfoy fixes his gaze steadily on Harry, then turns to glare at Percy with a withering look. In the Slytherin common room, Draco slumps onto a leather sofa with an air of arrogance and superiority. Looking around nervously, Harry and Ron sit down opposite him. Ron clenches his fist in anticipation, and Harry gives Ron a nudge with his elbow. Draco stares intently and fixedly at Harry, then rises to his feet and looks down at him ominously. To Harry's immense relief and comfort, Draco eventually backs off. Ron looks at Harry with surprise, picks up a small parcel, and gives it an inquisitive shake. Harry shakes his head in response, and Draco slips the parcel into his pocket. Ron springs up suddenly, and Harry quickly warns him. Ron looks at Harry in dismay as Harry touches his forehead, where his scar is beginning to reappear with a faint twinge.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: The huge giant, with his towering presence, turns and strides out of the room, leaving Harry standing there, watching him with an uncertain expression. Harry's gaze lingers on the door for a moment before he shakes his head, trying to clear his thoughts. Outside, a pure white landscape unfolds, revealing a magical scene where high-stepping white horses emerge gracefully from the snow-covered forest. These majestic creatures trot with elegance, pulling behind them handsome sleighs filled with students who are bundled up warmly against the biting cold. Inside the Great Hall, the atmosphere is transformed with the festive decoration of tall Christmas trees, and the enchanted ceiling mirrors the wintry weather outside, with huge snowflakes gently floating above the heads of the students who are seated at the long, polished dining tables. At one of these tables, Harry and Ron sit together at the far end, somewhat isolated, when Hermione approaches, carrying her meal down the hall. She takes a seat opposite them and, with a smile, holds up two cakes as if offering a treat. Later, in a different part of the castle, Ron, with Harry following closely behind, cautiously peers around a statue in the corridor. He scans the area to ensure no one is around, then lifts his crooked wand with determination. In response, Harry waves his wand, causing the two cakes to float into the air, suspended by magic. The two boys quickly hide as Crabbe and Goyle appear, their arms laden with cake. Spotting the floating cakes, Crabbe and Goyle eagerly grab them and begin to eat, greedily smacking their lips and stuffing the cakes into their mouths with abandon. Their chewing suddenly halts as their eyes roll up, and they both collapse backward, hitting the floor with a thud. Later, in the girls' lavatory, Hermione carefully fills three glasses with a thick potion and hands one to Harry and another to Ron. They both eye the thick sludge with suspicion before dropping hairs into the potion. Ron grimaces at the sight, but they clink their glasses together in a show of solidarity and drink the potion all at once. Ron takes a swig and immediately rushes to the nearest cubicle, with Hermione following closely behind. Meanwhile, Harry drops his glass, clutching his stomach in agony as he staggers to the marble sink for support. He leans heavily on it, looking down in horror as the skin on his hands begins to bulge and bubble. When he glances up into the mirror, he sees his face erupting in a similar fashion. As he watches, his features gradually morph into those of the podgy Goyle. Tentatively, he lifts his hand and touches his newly transformed beefy face with plump fingers, feeling a sense of satisfaction with the transformation. Harry smiles at his reflection, then turns to see Ron emerging from the cubicle, now transformed into the fat-faced, dumpy Crabbe. They stare at each other in disbelief at their new appearances. In a dark corridor, Percy Weasley spots them, and Draco Malfoy fixes his gaze on Harry, then shifts his glare to Percy, giving him a withering look that sends a clear message. In the Slytherin common room, Draco slumps onto a leather sofa with an air of casual authority. Harry and Ron, feeling nervous, sit opposite him, trying to maintain their composure. Ron clenches his fist in a moment of tension, and Harry discreetly nudges him to stay calm. Draco's eyes lock onto Harry, and he rises to his feet, looking down at him with an ominous air. To Harry's relief, Draco eventually backs off, leaving Harry to exhale quietly. Ron, surprised by the turn of events, picks up a small parcel and gives it a shake, curious about its contents. Harry shakes his head in warning, and Draco, noticing the exchange, slips the parcel into his pocket. Suddenly, Ron springs up, and Harry quickly warns him, his voice tinged with urgency. Ron looks at Harry in dismay as Harry touches his forehead, feeling the familiar sensation of his scar reappearing, signaling the end of their transformation.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: The huge giant leaves the room, prompting Harry to look uncertainly before shaking his head. A pure white landscape emerges as white horses trot out of the snow-covered forest, pulling sleighs filled with warmly dressed students. In the Great Hall, decorated with tall Christmas trees and floating snowflakes, Harry and Ron sit alone at a table until Hermione joins them, offering two cakes. Later, Ron, followed by Harry, checks the corridor, lifts his wand, and Harry makes the cakes float. They hide as Crabbe and Goyle arrive, grab the floating cakes, and eat greedily until they collapse. In the girls' lavatory, Hermione fills three glasses, and they add hairs to the potion before drinking it. Ron heads to a cubicle, followed by Hermione, while Harry clutches his stomach in agony, watching his skin bulge and transform into Goyle's. Pleased, Harry smiles at his reflection and sees Ron emerge as Crabbe. In a dark corridor, Percy Weasley spots them, and Draco Malfoy glares at Percy before slumping onto a sofa in the Slytherin common room. Nervously, Harry and Ron sit opposite Draco, who stares ominously at Harry before backing off. Ron, surprised, picks up a parcel, but Harry shakes his head as Draco pockets it. Ron springs up, and Harry warns him, touching his forehead where his scar is reappearing.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: The huge giant, who is known as Hagrid, a keeper of keys and grounds at Hogwarts, leaves the room, and Harry looks at him uncertainly, then shakes his head. A pure white landscape emerges as high-stepping white horses, resembling the Abraxans known for their strength and grace, trot out of the snow-covered forest, drawing handsome sleighs full of students well-wrapped against the cold. In the Great Hall, an enormous and enchanted dining area at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry, now decorated with tall Christmas trees brought in by the groundskeeper, the ceiling reflects the weather outside, and huge snowflakes float above the heads of the students sitting at the long, polished dining tables. Harry and Ron are sitting by themselves at the end of one of the tables when Hermione, who is known for her intelligence and resourcefulness, carries her meal down the hall and sits opposite them. She holds up two cakes, which they have enchanted with a potion. Later, followed by Harry, Ron peers around a statue of a stern-looking witch in the corridor, makes sure the coast is clear, and lifts his crooked wand, which he is too stubborn to repair. Harry waves his wand, a finely crafted piece made from holly and phoenix feather, and the two cakes float into the air. Harry and Ron hide as Crabbe and Goyle appear with armfuls of cake. They see the floating cakes, grab them, and start to eat them, greedily smacking their lips and stuffing the cakes into their mouths. They suddenly stop chewing as their eyes roll up, and they both fall over backward and hit the floor, knocked unconscious by the potion. Later, in the girls' lavatory, which is haunted by Moaning Myrtle, Hermione fills three glasses and hands one to Harry and one to Ron. They look at their thick sludge suspiciously and put the hairs into the potion, which is known as Polyjuice Potion for transformation. Ron pulls a face, and clinking glasses, they all drink at once. Ron takes a swig and heads for the nearest cubicle, followed by Hermione. Harry drops his glass and clutches his stomach in agony as the transformation begins. He staggers to the marble sink and leans on it. Looking down, he sees the skin on his hands begin to bulge and bubble, and when Harry looks into the mirror, his face is also erupting. As he watches, he gradually turns into podgy Goyle, a member of the Slytherin house. He lifts his hand and touches his beefy face with plump fingers. Pleased with the transformation, Harry smiles, then turns and sees Ron coming out of the cubicle, transformed into fat-faced, dumpy Crabbe, another Slytherin. They stare at each other. In a dark corridor, Percy Weasley, a prefect known for his adherence to rules, spots them, and Draco Malfoy, a Slytherin student with a notorious reputation for disdain towards Gryffindors, stares at Harry, then glares at Percy, giving him a withering look. In the Slytherin common room, located in the dungeons of Hogwarts, Draco slumps onto a leather sofa. Looking around nervously, Harry and Ron sit opposite him. Ron clenches his fist, and Harry nudges Ron. Draco stares at Harry, then gets to his feet and looks down at him ominously. To Harry's relief, Draco backs off, possibly suspecting something is amiss. Ron looks at Harry with surprise, picks up a small parcel, and shakes it. Harry shakes his head, and Draco puts the parcel in his pocket. Ron springs up, and Harry warns Ron, who looks at him in dismay as Harry touches his forehead where his iconic lightning-shaped scar is reappearing.

test_cases.name: Addition (~50%)
test_cases.description: The huge giant leaves the room and Harry looks at him uncertainly then shakes his head. A pure white landscape emerges as highstepping white horses trot out of the snowcovered forest drawing handsome sleighs full of students wellwrapped against the cold. In the Great Hall now decorated with tall Christmas trees the ceiling reflects the weather outside and huge snowflakes float above the heads of the students sitting at the long polished dining tables. Harry and Ron are sitting by themselves at the end of one of the tables when Hermione carries her meal down the hall and sits opposite them. She holds up two cakes. Later followed by Harry Ron peers around a statue in the corridor makes sure the coast is clear and lifts his crooked wand. Harry waves his wand and the two cakes float into the air. Harry and Ron hide as Crabbe and Goyle appear with armfuls of cake. They see the floating cakes grab them and start to eat them greedily smacking their lips and stuffing the cakes into their mouths. They suddenly stop chewing as their eyes roll up and they both fall over backward and hit the floor. Later in the girls' lavatory Hermione fills three glasses and hands one to Harry and one to Ron. They look at their thick sludge suspiciously and put the hairs into the potion. Ron pulls a face and clinking glasses. they all drink at once. Ron takes a swig and heads for the nearest cubicle followed by Hermione. Harry drops his glass and clutches his stomach in agony. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. He staggers to the marble sink and leans on it. Looking down he sees the skin on his hands begin to bulge and bubble and when Harry looks into the mirror his face is also erupting. As he watches he gradually turns into podgy Goyle. He lifts his hand and touches his beefy face with plump fingers. Pleased with the transformation Harry smiles then turns and sees Ron coming out of the cubicle transformed into fatfaced dumpy Crabbe. They stare at each other. In a dark corridor Percy Weasley spots them and Draco Malfoy stares at Harry then glares at Percy giving him a withering look. In the Slytherin common room Draco slumps onto a leather sofa. Looking around nervously. Harry and Ron sit opposite him. Ron clenches his fist and Harry nudges Ron. Draco stares at Harry then gets to his feet and looks down at him ominously. To Harry's relief. Draco backs off Ron looks at Harry with surprise picks up a small parcel and shakes it. Harry shakes his head and Draco puts the parcel in his pocket. Ron springs up and Harry warns Ron who looks at him in dismay as Harry touches his forehead where his scar is reappearing.

test_cases.name: Subject Corruption
test_cases.description: The huge panda leaves the room, and Margaret looks at the panda uncertainly, then shakes her head. A pure white landscape emerges as high-stepping white kangaroos trot out of the snow-covered forest, drawing handsome sleighs full of students well-wrapped against the cold. In the Great Hall, now decorated with tall Christmas trees, the ceiling reflects the weather outside, and huge snowflakes float above the heads of the students sitting at the long, polished dining tables. Margaret and Tim are sitting by themselves at the end of one of the tables when Jessica carries her meal down the hall and sits opposite them. She holds up two cakes. Later, followed by Margaret, Tim peers around a statue in the corridor, makes sure the coast is clear, and lifts his crooked wand. Margaret waves her wand, and the two cakes float into the air. Margaret and Tim hide as Neville and Dennis appear with armfuls of cake. They see the floating cakes, grab them, and start to eat them, greedily smacking their lips and stuffing the cakes into their mouths. They suddenly stop chewing as their eyes roll up, and they both fall over backward and hit the floor. Later, in the girls' lavatory, Jessica fills three glasses and hands one to Margaret and one to Tim. They look at their thick sludge suspiciously and put the hairs into the potion. Tim pulls a face, and clinking glasses, they all drink at once. Tim takes a swig and heads for the nearest cubicle, followed by Jessica. Margaret drops her glass and clutches her stomach in agony. She staggers to the marble sink and leans on it. Looking down, she sees the skin on her hands begin to bulge and bubble, and when Margaret looks into the mirror, her face is also erupting. As she watches, she gradually turns into podgy Dennis. She lifts her hand and touches her beefy face with plump fingers. Pleased with the transformation, Margaret smiles, then turns and sees Tim coming out of the cubicle, transformed into fat-faced, dumpy Neville. They stare at each other. In a dark corridor, Luna Lovegood spots them, and Susan Bones stares at Margaret, then glares at Luna, giving her a withering look. In the Slytherin common room, Susan slumps onto a leather sofa. Looking around nervously, Margaret and Tim sit opposite her. Tim clenches his fist, and Margaret nudges Tim. Susan stares at Margaret, then gets to her feet and looks down at her ominously. To Margaret's relief, Susan backs off. Tim looks at Margaret with surprise, picks up a small parcel, and shakes it. Margaret shakes her head, and Susan puts the parcel in her pocket. Tim springs up, and Margaret warns Tim, who looks at her in dismay as Margaret touches her forehead where her scar is reappearing.

test_cases.name: Object Corruption
test_cases.description: The huge giant leaves the cabin, and Harry looks at him uncertainly, then shakes his head. A pure white beach emerges as high-stepping white camels trot out of the sand-covered oasis, drawing handsome carriages full of students well-wrapped against the chill. In the Great Hall, now decorated with tall palm trees, the walls reflect the weather outside, and huge raindrops float above the heads of the students sitting at the long, polished workbenches. Harry and Ron are sitting by themselves at the end of one of the workbenches when Hermione carries her sandwich down the hall and sits opposite them. She holds up two pies. Later, followed by Harry, Ron peers around a painting in the corridor, makes sure the coast is clear, and lifts his twisted umbrella. Harry waves his umbrella, and the two pies float into the air. Harry and Ron hide as Crabbe and Goyle appear with armfuls of pudding. They see the floating pies, grab them, and start to eat them, greedily smacking their lips and stuffing the pies into their mouths. They suddenly stop chewing as their eyes roll up, and they both fall over backward and hit the ground. Later, in the girls' laundry room, Hermione fills three mugs and hands one to Harry and one to Ron. They look at their thick syrup suspiciously and put the threads into the potion. Ron pulls a face, and clinking mugs, they all drink at once. Ron takes a swig and heads for the nearest shower stall, followed by Hermione. Harry drops his mug and clutches his stomach in agony. He staggers to the steel sink and leans on it. Looking down, he sees the skin on his hands begin to bulge and bubble, and when Harry looks into the mirror, his face is also erupting. As he watches, he gradually turns into podgy Goyle. He lifts his hand and touches his beefy face with plump fingers. Pleased with the transformation, Harry smiles, then turns and sees Ron coming out of the shower stall, transformed into fat-faced, dumpy Crabbe. They stare at each other. In a dim hallway, Percy Weasley spots them, and Draco Malfoy stares at Harry, then glares at Percy, giving him a withering look. In the Slytherin common room, Draco slumps onto a velvet armchair. Looking around nervously, Harry and Ron sit opposite him. Ron clenches his foot, and Harry nudges Ron. Draco stares at Harry, then gets to his feet and looks down at him ominously. To Harry's relief, Draco backs off. Ron looks at Harry with surprise, picks up a small statue, and shakes it. Harry shakes his head, and Draco puts the statue in his pocket. Ron springs up, and Harry warns Ron, who looks at him in dismay as Harry touches his forehead where his scar is reappearing.

test_cases.name: Action Corruption
test_cases.description: The huge giant enters the room, and Harry stares at him confidently, then nods his head. A pure white landscape dissolves as low-sailing white horses gallop out of the snow-covered forest, pulling elegant carriages full of students lightly dressed against the heat. In the Great Hall, now redecorated with short palm trees, the ceiling absorbs the weather outside, and delicate raindrops hover above the heads of the students positioned at the long, rugged dining tables. Harry and Ron are standing by themselves at the edge of one of the tables when Hermione delivers her drink across the hall and stands opposite them. She lowers two cakes. Later, followed by Harry, Ron sneaks around a statue in the corridor, makes sure the hallway is empty, and drops his crooked wand. Harry twirls his wand, and the two cakes drift into the air. Harry and Ron emerge as Crabbe and Goyle arrive with pockets full of cake. They notice the rising cakes, leave them, and begin to devour them, delicately licking their lips and munching the cakes into their mouths. They suddenly continue chewing as their eyes blink rapidly, and they both stand up and hit the ceiling. Later, in the girls' lavatory, Hermione empties three glasses and places one in front of Harry and one in front of Ron. They glance at their thin mist lightly and place the hairs onto the potion. Ron grins, and clinking glasses, they all sip at once. Ron takes a gulp and heads for the nearest mirror, followed by Hermione. Harry picks up his glass and clutches his stomach with delight. He slides to the marble sink and leans away from it. Looking up, he sees the skin on his hands begin to shrink and smooth, and when Harry looks into the mirror, his face is also smoothing. As he observes, he gradually transforms into slender Goyle. He lowers his hand and pats his lean face with slender fingers. Displeased with the transformation, Harry frowns, then turns and observes Ron emerging from the cubicle, turned into slender-faced, slim Crabbe. They blink at each other. In a bright corridor, Percy Weasley ignores them, and Draco Malfoy looks at Harry, then smiles at Percy, giving him a supportive glance. In the Slytherin common room, Draco sprawls onto a wooden stool. Looking around confidently, Harry and Ron stand adjacent to him. Ron opens his palm, and Harry nudges Ron. Draco glances at Harry, then sits down and looks up at him warmly. To Harry's worry, Draco approaches closer. Ron glances at Harry with understanding, picks up a large box, and places it down. Harry nods, and Draco leaves the box on the floor. Ron sits down, and Harry encourages Ron, who glances at him in relief as Harry shields his forehead where his scar is vanishing.

test_cases.name: Subject-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: The enormous sunflower exits the garage, and Oliver gazes at it uncertainly, then shrugs his shoulders. A bright azure ocean emerges as gliding emerald dolphins leap out of the wave-covered canyon, pulling sleek sailboats full of musicians well-wrapped against the chill. In the Grand Station, now decorated with towering chandeliers, the walls reflect the vistas outside, and massive raindrops hover above the heads of the musicians seated at the elongated, polished conference tables. Oliver and Gary are sitting by themselves at the end of one of the tables when Emily carries her instrument down the corridor and sits across from them. She holds up two pies. Later, accompanied by Oliver, Gary peers around a monument in the passageway, makes sure the area is clear, and raises his bent baton. Oliver waves his baton, and the two pies ascend into the air. Oliver and Gary hide as Taylor and Jordan appear with armfuls of pie. They see the hovering pies, seize them, and begin to eat them, voraciously smacking their tongues and cramming the pies into their mouths. They suddenly halt chewing as their eyes roll back, and they both topple backward and slam onto the ground. Later, in the boys' greenhouse, Emily fills three mugs and hands one to Oliver and one to Gary. They look at their dense syrup suspiciously and put the feathers into the elixir. Gary makes a grimace, and clinking mugs, they all imbibe at once. Gary takes a gulp and heads for the nearest stall, followed by Emily. Oliver drops his mug and clutches his stomach in distress. He stumbles to the obsidian fountain and leans on it. Looking downward, he sees the surface on his limbs begin to swell and ripple, and when Oliver gazes into the window, his visage is also erupting. As he observes, he gradually transforms into stout Jordan. He raises his limb and touches his robust visage with chubby digits. Satisfied with the alteration, Oliver grins, then pivots and sees Gary emerging from the stall, transformed into round-featured, squat Taylor. They gape at each other. In a dim passageway, Percy Johnson notices them, and Lucas Black scrutinizes Oliver, then glowers at Percy, casting him a disdainful expression. In the Ravenclaw alcove, Lucas collapses onto a velvet hammock. Glancing around anxiously, Oliver and Gary sit across from him. Gary clenches his palm, and Oliver nudges Gary. Lucas scrutinizes Oliver, then rises to his feet and peers down at him menacingly. To Oliver's solace, Lucas retreats. Gary looks at Oliver in astonishment, picks up a tiny package, and jostles it. Oliver shakes his head, and Lucas places the package in his satchel. Gary leaps up, and Oliver cautions Gary, who looks at him in despair as Oliver touches his shoulder where his mark is reappearing.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: The towering elf enters the kitchen, and Luna glances at her skeptically, then tilts her head. An endless dark ocean materializes as low-gliding black crows glide out of the ice-covered jungle, pulling fancy chariots full of teachers bundled warmly against the breeze. In the Large Library, now adorned with short pine bushes, the walls mirror the atmosphere outside, and tiny raindrops drift above the heads of the teachers positioned at the long, gleaming study desks. Luna and Neville are standing by themselves at the edge of one of the desks when Ginny drags her lunch across the room and stands opposite them. She raises two sandwiches. Later, followed by Luna, Neville peers over a painting in the hallway, ensures the path is clear, and twists his bent broomstick. Luna flicks her broomstick, and the two sandwiches glide through the air. Luna and Neville conceal themselves as Fred and George march with bundles of sandwiches. They notice the gliding sandwiches, snatch them, and begin to devour them, eagerly munching and cramming the sandwiches into their mouths. They suddenly halt munching as their eyes glaze over, and they both topple over forward and slump onto the ground. Later, in the boys' bathroom, Ginny pours three cups and hands one to Luna and one to Neville. They examine their thin potion skeptically and toss the feathers into the brew. Neville makes a grimace, and tapping cups, they all sip together. Neville gulps a mouthful and dashes for the closest stall, followed by Ginny. Luna drops her cup and grips her chest in discomfort. She lurches to the granite toilet and leans against it. Gazing down, she watches the skin on her arms begin to swell and ripple, and when Luna looks into the reflection, her face is also expanding. As she observes, she gradually morphs into slender George. She raises her hand and caresses her angular face with long fingers. Satisfied with the alteration, Luna grins, then turns and sees Neville emerging from the stall, transformed into sharp-jawed, lean Fred. They gaze at each other. In a dim hallway, Oliver Wood notices them, and Pansy Parkinson glares at Luna, then smirks at Oliver, giving him an amused glance. In the Gryffindor lounge, Pansy collapses onto a velvet chair. Observing quietly, Luna and Neville perch across from her. Neville uncurls his fingers, and Luna taps Neville. Pansy glowers at Luna, then stands up and gazes down at her menacingly. To Luna's satisfaction, Pansy steps away. Neville glances at Luna with astonishment, picks up a tiny box, and rattles it. Luna tilts her head, and Pansy places the box in her bag. Neville leaps up, and Luna cautions Neville, who stares at her in shock as Luna brushes her arm where her tattoo is reappearing.

test_cases.name: Object-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: The large ogre exits the barn, and Harry gazes at him warily, then nods his head. A vibrant desert scene appears as slow-moving camels amble out of the sun-drenched oasis, pulling ornate carriages full of spectators lightly dressed against the heat. In the Grand Chamber, now adorned with short palm trees, the walls mirror the conditions outside, and tiny raindrops drift above the heads of the spectators reclining on the short, rough benches. Harry and Ron are resting by themselves at the edge of one of the benches when Hermione maneuvers her dessert up the alley and places herself across from them. She lifts two loaves. Later, trailed by Harry, Ron sneaks behind a monument in the hallway, verifies the path is open, and swings his straight staff. Harry flicks his staff, and the two loaves glide into the breeze. Harry and Ron crouch as Crabbe and Goyle arrive with heaps of cookies. They notice the gliding loaves, snatch them, and start to devour them, merrily humming and cramming the loaves into their ears. They abruptly halt chewing as their eyes drift down, and they both topple headfirst and strike the ceiling. Later, in the boys' kitchen, Hermione fills three bottles and hands one to Harry and one to Ron. They glance at their thin liquid skeptically and toss the feathers into the brew. Ron contorts his mouth, and clanging bottles, they all sip together. Ron takes a gulp and heads for the farthest counter, trailed by Hermione. Harry drops his bottle and grasps his knee in comfort. He collapses onto the wooden floor and leans against it. Peering down, he notices the cloth on his knees begin to shrink and solidify, and when Harry gazes into the reflection, his knees are also transforming. As he observes, he gradually transforms into slimy Goyle. He raises his foot and taps his greasy knees with skinny toes. Content with the alteration, Harry grins, then spins and notices Ron emerging from the counter, transformed into thin-eared, lanky Crabbe. They gawk at one another. In a dim alleyway, Percy Weasley locates them, and Draco Malfoy gawks at Harry, then smirks at Percy, bestowing upon him a mocking grin. In the Slytherin encampment, Draco collapses onto a velvet mattress. Surveying the space anxiously, Harry and Ron recline across from him. Ron opens his hand, and Harry nudges Ron. Draco gawks at Harry, then rises to his toes and peers up at him amiably. To Harry's delight, Draco saunters away. Ron glances at Harry with awe, lifts a large box, and rattles it. Harry shakes his head, and Draco places the box in his bag. Ron leaps up, and Harry cautions Ron, who glances at him in shock as Harry brushes his elbow where his tattoo is emerging.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: The petite fairy exits the cavern, and Timmy squints at her doubtingly, then waves his tail. A vivid red desert materializes as softly trotting green camels march out of the sand-filled jungle, pulling colorful wagons packed with travelers bundled against the heat. In the Enchanted Chamber, now adorned with short palm trees, the walls echo the conditions outside, and bright petals drift above the heads of the visitors lounging on the long, rustic benches. Timmy and Max are lounging together at the beginning of one of the benches when Sally hauls her feast up the chamber and lounges across from them. She waves two pies. Later, trailed by Timmy, Max peeks around a fountain in the hallway, checks the setting is secure, and raises his bent cane. Timmy sways his cane, and the two pies ascend into the breeze. Timmy and Max scurry as Ike and Mike arrive with bundles of pie. They notice the levitating pies, snatch them, and begin to consume them, eagerly smacking their tongues and devouring the pies into their throats. They abruptly pause swallowing as their noses tilt upward, and they both topple forward and strike the ground. Later, in the boys' library, Sally fills three bowls and offers one to Timmy and one to Max. They gaze at their thick gruel suspiciously and toss the feathers into the brew. Max grimaces, and clinking bowls, they all sip together. Max takes a gulp and darts for the nearest stall, trailed by Sally. Timmy drops his bowl and clutches his belly in distress. He stumbles to the wooden counter and braces against it. Looking upwards, he sees the skin on his arms start to ripple and crack, and when Timmy glances at the reflection, his profile is also altering. As he observes, he gradually becomes lanky George. He raises his elbow and pats his narrow chin with slender fingers. Content with the metamorphosis, Timmy grins, then pivots and notices Max stepping out of the stall, transformed into spiky-haired, lanky Al. They gaze at one another. In a dim hallway, Percy Weasley detects them, and Billy May glares at Timmy, then scowls at Percy, gifting him a scornful stare. In the Hufflepuff club lounge, Billy collapses onto a velvet recliner. Glancing around cautiously, Timmy and Max recline across from him. Max squeezes his elbow, and Timmy elbows Max. Billy glances at Timmy, then rises to his toes and gazes at him threateningly. To Timmy's comfort, Billy retreats. Max glances at Timmy with amazement, picks up a tiny cube, and jostles it. Timmy nods, and Billy slips the cube in his pouch. Max leaps up, and Timmy advises Max, who glances at him in disbelief as Timmy pats his chin where his whisker is reappearing.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: The giant departs, leaving Harry uncertain. A snowy landscape and sleighs emerge, leading students to the Christmas-decorated Great Hall. Harry, Ron, and Hermione sit together, and later, Harry and Ron use wands to levitate cakes, which Crabbe and Goyle eat before fainting. In the girls' lavatory, Hermione shares a potion with Harry and Ron, who drink it, transforming into Crabbe and Goyle. Harry experiences pain but successfully transforms. In a corridor, they encounter Percy Weasley and Draco Malfoy. In the Slytherin common room, Draco confronts them briefly before backing off. Ron discovers a parcel, with Harry warning him as his scar begins to reappear.

test_cases.name: Reverse Segments Order
test_cases.description: Ron springs up and Harry warns Ron who looks at him in dismay as Harry touches his forehead where his scar is reappearing Harry shakes his head and Draco puts the parcel in his pocket  Draco backs off Ron looks at Harry with surprise picks up a small parcel and shakes it  To Harry's relief  Draco stares at Harry then gets to his feet and looks down at him ominously  Ron clenches his fist and Harry nudges Ron  Harry and Ron sit opposite him  Looking around nervously  In the Slytherin common room Draco slumps onto a leather sofa  In a dark corridor Percy Weasley spots them and Draco Malfoy stares at Harry then glares at Percy giving him a withering look  They stare at each other  Pleased with the transformation Harry smiles then turns and sees Ron coming out of the cubicle transformed into fatfaced dumpy Crabbe  He lifts his hand and touches his beefy face with plump fingers  As he watches he gradually turns into podgy Goyle  Looking down he sees the skin on his hands begin to bulge and bubble and when Harry looks into the mirror his face is also erupting  He staggers to the marble sink and leans on it  Harry drops his glass and clutches his stomach in agony  Ron takes a swig and heads for the nearest cubicle followed by Hermione  they all drink at once  Ron pulls a face and clinking glasses  They look at their thick sludge suspiciously and put the hairs into the potion  Later in the girls' lavatory Hermione fills three glasses and hands one to Harry and one to Ron  They suddenly stop chewing as their eyes roll up and they both fall over backward and hit the floor  They see the floating cakes grab them and start to eat them greedily smacking their lips and stuffing the cakes into their mouths  Harry and Ron hide as Crabbe and Goyle appear with armfuls of cake  Harry waves his wand and the two cakes float into the air  Later followed by Harry Ron peers around a statue in the corridor makes sure the coast is clear and lifts his crooked wand  She holds up two cakes  Harry and Ron are sitting by themselves at the end of one of the tables when Hermione carries her meal down the hall and sits opposite them  In the Great Hall now decorated with tall Christmas trees the ceiling reflects the weather outside and huge snowflakes float above the heads of the students sitting at the long polished dining tables  A pure white landscape emerges as highstepping white horses trot out of the snowcovered forest drawing handsome sleighs full of students wellwrapped against the cold  The huge giant leaves the room and Harry looks at him uncertainly then shakes his head
